events.originalText: The first version of the Instagram mobile application was released for iOS devices.
events.subtitle: Instagram
events.headline: Instagram mobile app released for iOS devices

events.originalText: The MESSENGER probe discovered Mercury's Rembrandt (pictured) – the second largest impact crater on the planet.
events.subtitle: MESSENGER
events.headline: MESSENGER probe discovers Mercury's Rembrandt crater

events.originalText: Al-Qaeda bombed the oil tanker Limburg, causing oil to leak into the Gulf of Aden.
events.subtitle: Al-Qaeda
events.headline: Al-Qaeda bombs oil tanker Limburg, causing Gulf of Aden oil leak

events.originalText: Al-Qaeda bombed the oil tanker Limburg, causing oil to leak into the Gulf of Aden.
events.subtitle: Al-Qaeda
events.headline: Vice President Carlos Álvarez resigns over corruption in Argentine administration

events.originalText: Denouncing corruption in Argentine president Fernando de la Rúa's administration and the Senate, Vice President Carlos Álvarez resigned.
events.subtitle: Fernando de la Rúa
events.headline: Gay student Matthew Shepard fatally wounded near Laramie, Wyoming

events.originalText: University of Wyoming gay student Matthew Shepard was attacked and fatally wounded near Laramie, Wyoming, U.S., dying six days later.
events.subtitle: University of Wyoming
events.headline: First exoplanet discovered orbiting 51 Pegasi

events.originalText: Matthew Shepard, a gay college student, was attacked and fatally wounded near Laramie, Wyoming, U.S., dying six days later.
events.subtitle: Matthew Shepard
events.headline: San Francisco Police Department instigates riot in the Castro

events.originalText: Astronomers Michel Mayor and Didier Queloz reported the discovery of a planet orbiting 51 Pegasi as the first known exoplanet around a main-sequence star.
events.subtitle: Michel Mayor
events.headline: Police constable Keith Blakelock killed during rioting in Tottenham

events.originalText: About 200 members of the San Francisco Police Department instigated a police riot in the Castro following a peaceful protest held by ACT UP.
events.subtitle: San Francisco Police Department
events.headline: Egyptian president Anwar Sadat assassinated during parade in Cairo

events.originalText: Police constable Keith Blakelock was killed during rioting in the Broadwater Farm housing estate in Tottenham, London.
events.subtitle: Murder of Keith Blakelock
events.headline: Cubana Flight 455 bombed, killing all 73 aboard

events.originalText: Egyptian president Anwar Sadat was assassinated while attending a parade in Cairo to mark the eighth anniversary of the Crossing of the Bar Lev Line at the start of the 1973 Arab-Israeli War.
events.subtitle: Anwar Sadat
events.headline: Egyptian forces cross Suez Canal to attack Israeli forces

events.originalText: Two bombs placed by the CIA-linked Cuban dissident group Coordination of United Revolutionary Organizations exploded on Cubana Flight 455, killing all 73 aboard.
events.subtitle: Central Intelligence Agency
events.headline: Catalonia declares general strike and armed insurgency

events.originalText: Egyptian forces crossed the Suez Canal (pictured) to attack occupying Israeli forces at the Bar Lev Line, starting the Yom Kippur War.
events.subtitle: Suez Canal
events.headline: The Jazz Singer released with synchronized music score

events.originalText: Catalonia's autonomous government declared a general strike, an armed insurgency, and the establishment of the Catalan State in reaction to the inclusion of conservatives in the Spanish republican regime.
events.subtitle: Catalonia
events.headline: Austria-Hungary annexes Bosnia and Herzegovina, damaging relations

events.originalText: The Jazz Singer, one of the first feature-length motion pictures with a synchronized recorded music score, was released.
events.subtitle: The Jazz Singer
events.headline: Fort Clinton and Fort Montgomery captured by British forces

events.originalText: Austria-Hungary announced the annexation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, causing a crisis that permanently damaged the country's relations with the Russian Empire and the Kingdom of Serbia.
events.subtitle: Austria-Hungary
events.headline: Battle of Manila ends with British victory over Spain

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Fort Clinton and Fort Montgomery were captured by British forces under Sir Henry Clinton, dismantling the Hudson River Chains.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Wang Shichong's army defeats Li Mi at Battle of Yanshi

events.originalText: Seven Years' War: The Battle of Manila concluded with a British victory over Spain, leading to a twenty-month occupation.
events.subtitle: Seven Years' War

events.originalText: Seven Years' War: The Battle of Manila concluded with a British victory over Spain, leading to a twenty-month occupation.
events.subtitle: Seven Years' War

events.originalText: Wang Shichong's army defeated Li Mi's at the Battle of Yanshi, allowing Wang to consolidate his power and soon depose China's Sui dynasty.
events.subtitle: Wang Shichong
